page.title:
Summer in Australia?
Summer in Australia?

Recent Review
Recent Review
page.normal_text:
APAC in the future must be regarded not just as the National Facility, but as the sum of its component parts comprising: […] The National Grid […]
APAC in the future must be regarded not just as the
National Facility, but as the sum of its component
parts comprising:
[…]
The National Grid
[…]

That the APAC National Grid must be the pre-eminent
That the APAC National Grid must be the pre-eminent

grid in Australia and continue extending its coverage to include capabilities wherever they exist or develop. It must also nurture and support scientific research teams, NCRIS infrastructure and international partnerships
grid in Australia and continue extending its coverage
to include capabilities wherever they exist or
develop. It must also nurture and support scientific
research teams, NCRIS infrastructure and
international partnerships

page.title:
Gateways
Gateways
page.enlisting:

page.title:
Middleware Stack
Middleware Stack
page.enlisting:
• We’re using VDT – For both GT2 and GT4 – Inclusion of VOMS/VOMRS/GUMS is nice • Actively doing QA, and finding and reporting • Add portal and data components to core VDT for other gateways – SRB, GridSphere • Java tool Grix for simplified certificate management by users – APAC has IGTF-audited CA • We’re using VDT

page.title:
Data services
Data services
page.enlisting:
• Data is hard – Different communities have different needs – Complex access controls • We have gridftp between sites – Network consistency is interesting … • SRB today; iRODS later this year • Dcache, SRM, Gfarm as communities require • Credible use cases for a global file system? • Data is hard

page.title:
Improved AAA Services
Improved AAA Services
page.enlisting:
• NCRIS will require e-research services to a much wider community than traditional HPC – PKI doesn’t scale and is conceptually difficult for non computer • Australian Access Federation funded • IAM Suite from MELCOE – Shibboleth authentication plus appropriate attributes generates – Tools for users to easily create shared workspaces and manage • Only a few people will need real certificates • But a year or two before being ready for prime time • NCRIS will require e-research services to a much
• NCRIS will require e-research services to a much • N C R I S

page.title:
Future Strategies
Future Strategies
page.enlisting:
• data from instruments, government agencies • Expand the user base – NCRIS, Merit Allocation Scheme, Partners – Open access to core grid services • Expand the services – Workflow engines and tools – Kepler, Taverna – Data management: metadata support, collections registry • Expand the facilities – Include major data centres – Include institutional systems and repositories • Resulting changes: – Policies: acceptable service provision – Organisation: coordinated user support – Architecture: scaling gateways – Technologies: Attribute-based authorisation • data from instruments, government agencies
